snippet: The end of a professional athlete’s career can be difficult, whether it be Venus Williams, who says she has plenty of tennis left, or Bernie Williams, who played 16 seasons with the Yankees.
abstract: William C Rhoden Sports of The Times column asserts that Venus Williams's defiant comments after being ousted in the first round at Wimbledon reflect the determination, commitment and will of a championship athlete; suggests that they also underline the difficulty a champion has of entertaining the notion of the impending end of a brilliant career.
lead_paragraph: The end of a professional athlete’s career can be difficult, whether it be Venus Williams, who says she has plenty of tennis left, or Bernie Williams, who played 16 seasons with the Yankees.

headline.seo: Professional Athletes Find It Difficult to End a Career
headline.main: End of the First Act Is Easier to Bear if There Is a Second
headline.print_headline: End of the First Act Is Easier to Bear if There Is a Second
